intro: Psychotria trichotoma var. trichophylla, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. This variant is closely related to other Psychotria species and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
